Well my history teacher always said if u are unsure about something u can always look into the past to compare and predict. 
 
 Well i've done just that with the War in Iraq. If u study the war with Iraq and the Inca conquest u will find there are many similiarities. Pizzaro went into the Inca empire and warped there internal government from despotism to monarchy and used puppets from the high ranking officials in the Inca civilization. Spain gained a lot of resources while Inca civilians are killed everyday in the streets
 
 Today Bush goes into Iraq and warp their internal government by changing it to democracy and we already have some "Americanize" Muslims ready to take the title president of Iraq. You might as well call him a puppet because the US will be getting dibs on all the oil Iraq contains. Spain used the idea of spreading Christianity today were using the idea of spreading Democracy. The Inca war strenghtened the Spaniards just like this Iraq war strenghtens the US.
 
 My point is many historians look back at the Inca conquest and denounce it as a act of greed and intimidation. The same thing will happen in this war in the long run. Many today already see it as an act of greed and an act of bullying in the Middle East.
There's a difference... the US isn't out to steal resources and build empire.
says who? Your information comes through a media filtered by a goverment organization, so how do you know?

Wars are merely means of buttressing the economy. When you've succeeded in pacifying another nation it opens up the door for new opportunities. Establishments and corporations can move into the newfound territory and make lucrative gains. It's been all over the news. Everyone knows we're setting up commercialism there and inviting and offering our coalition partners, and even some non-participants, a piece of the pie.
 This war was nothing more than a geopolitical move. Anyone with half a braincell could calculate the outcome of this war.

Interesting point.
 
 When the american walked into baghdad, and saw there was no such thing as iraqi army, what did they do?
 
 While iraqis were looting everything they could lay there hands on, hospital equipment, carpets, chairs, university, archeological treasures. What did the "liberating" american troops do? They guarded the offices of the oil ministry.
 
 Just as pizaro went for the yellow gold, bush goes for black gold.
I think we are more like cortez and the aztecs. We got welcomed in with a minimaul amount of trouble as something we weren't and then screwed the population when it was to late.
Ummm... The spaniards murdered and used the Incas as slave labour. They murdered millions. Are you guys serious?

Quit harssing our buzz! Leave us alone with your truths and your "facts". We like it here comparing the U.S. going into Iraq with Spaniards going into the America's. Besides every analogy will fail if you break it down enough
 
 LOL
 
 We were simply making the point that the U.S. is going into iraq for the same reasons the spaniards went into the america's. We are not saying america is similiar in treatment to the local popluation to the spaniards, only that their motives were the same.

We could have let American companies into Iraq if we had just stopped vetoing the resolution to let everyone else in. :)
 
 Oil accounts for 98% of Iraq's GDP. You would let them take the oil ministry and destroy the only source of money that could help rebuild the country?

us the quoting thing. And if you can't do what I do, just cut and paste and put the guys name over it.
 
 Can't understand who your responding too, or what your opinion is!

We were simply making the point that the U.S. is going into iraq for the same reasons the spaniards went into the america's. 

 
 I see. Well, sorry for 'harrasing your buzz'! :)
